H0.text: Engine is the best example of a part of the propulsion system of a tractor.

H1.text: Front headlight is the best example of a part of the propulsion system of a tractor.

H2.text: Hood is the best example of a part of the propulsion system of a tractor.

H3.text: Steering wheel is the best example of a part of the propulsion system of a tractor.

A4.text: Since the turn of the 20th century, internal combustion engines have been the power source of choice for tractors.

A5.text: The engine is responsible for providing power to the tractor's wheels and attachments through mechanisms like power take-off (PTO) shafts and hydraulic systems.
